file_content.text: He's still recovering. Once he wakes up, I'll tell him everything you did.
I've got the water. Let's hope it really can flush that poison.
The hive mind was distracted. The Killiks lost their hold on him, with my help.
He's going to pull through. I don't know how, but the water neutralized the toxins in his bloodstream.
Sometimes the Force alone won't heal us. I'm glad you were here. So is he.
Please hurry. His time's running out.
Breathe. Relax. I sense the hive mind. Countless voices, imprinting, taking hold... blast! I can't control it.
Master Jedi. I could use your skills.
Please. I need your help.
This man is in the process of being joined to the Killiks. I've tried everything, but he's beyond my power.
There must be some way to save this man.
We can't give up on him.
Force healing hasn't worked. One voice can't rise above a thousand.
There must be a counteragent. What was the assassin's preferred toxin?
Every poison has an antidote.
Prolonged exposure to Killik pheromones. This poor soldier was fighting them too long.
If the killer got this close, he could injure someone else.
Where's the assassin?
If he had fallen in battle or been taken prisoner...but this is unjust.
I've seen Chiss with better color.
He sure looks like it.
Please. He may be unconscious, but he can still hear us.
Was he the assassin's target, or just unlucky?
Who is he?
Each Killik is part of the greater collective, the hive mind. They think and speak and reason as one.
Then why bother me?
If this man is joined to the Killiks, he'll share their thoughts, their feelings...all at the cost of his own.
If the hive was distracted, maybe I could repel them. A surprise attack or raid...but I can't leave him.
That's a big 'if.'
We don't have any other choice. The joining process moves quick.
I'll focus, wait for the right moment before trying again. Hurry!
It won't help. [Refuse quest]
That's it, then. Within days, he'll be a full Joiner. Another drone.
Please give the man some air. The Killiks have done enough damage.
You're back! Look, his eyes...they're clearing up. Whatever you did, it worked.
You did your best.
This wasn't an accident.
Joined to the Killiks?
Say no more.
